Don't F**k with Cats: Hunting an Internet Killer

Review: A charming cinematic tribute to 80s classic science fiction movies. A small story, with few characters, and lots of atmosphere. Full of twists and turns, but also takes time.

A charming film, which expresses wonderful and unusual ideas of its kind. No big dreams, fancy fantasies or empty slogans. Just love life, for better or worse. I wish I had grown up on a movie like this.
Great sci thriller. Might confuse with the janeres mixing.
A wonderful combination of emotion and pain alongside satirical and poignant humor.So much creativity. So funny. With wonderful performances.

Bong John Ho is simply a creator of a different level from everything we know. Each of his films - unprecedented work of art.'' Parasites '' is a film that is difficult to describe without seeing. An analogy to class differences, between those who wont lack nothing - versus those who have nothing. Each scene leads to endless interpretation and thought.

A spectacular war movie reflecting the war scenes from the soldiers' mirror, in one shot. Everything feels real, strong and kicking. Very intense. Design and photography worth seeing on the big screen.

Martin Scorsese sums up his career. Decades of doing, full of stories, and crimes of all kinds. Robert De Niro, El Pacino and Joe Peschi, of course, in the classic role of the brutal and intelligent criminals.The film brings the lives of the characters to the forefront. You feel their world in your blood. You feel the pain, the old age, the loneliness. The script corresponds with death, with passing episodes in life, with the end of the days…

Such a sad movie.The kind of stories that make us think about how to be better people, how to create a better family.A movie that makes you understand the frustration of being a parent, the debilitating responsibility, and how much the heart may pay for it. Dustin Hoffman is just fantastic. Meryl Streep proves she can be in a movie for maybe a minute and still get an Oscar, and rightly so.Hard film, but important. worth watching

Movie: Once Upon a Time… in Hollywood

Review: The film is Goodfells' big brother, with De Niro in the lead role, Joe Fashi in the same role as the funny, fat member, and the business is working again. The same story about the criminal who becomes addicted to the hedonistic, unmoralistic life that leads to doom. Everything is so glamorous, huge, mean and cruel, as only Scorsese knows how to do. Just the same movie, but successful, as usual
